availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James J. Bryant (Warren County, Kentucky, shoe maker)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, shoe maker. Kentucky native. Married to Spicy Ann Shroader Bryant in Warren County, Kentucky, in July 1840. Father of Mary Bryant, John A. Bryant, Nancy Bryant, James Bryant, William J. Bryant, Virginia Bryant, and John C. Bryant. Shoemaker in Ohio County in 1850. Shoemaker in Warren County in 1860. Charged with the assault of Joseph Lewis in Edmonson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 49A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 836.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film 000164006.
"James J. Bryant (1820-1901)," Find A Grave, Memorial 49058674, accessed August 15, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/49058674.
KYR-0001-020-0120.
